TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CreateItemType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to create an item or response object.

remarks.para: The is used to create response objects and items in the Exchange database. The following table describes the items and response objects that can be created by using .

item.description: Represents a generic item to be created in the Exchange database.
Represents an e-mail message to be created in the Exchange database.
Represents a task to be created in the Exchange database.
Represents a contact item to be created in the Exchange database.
Represents a calendar entry to be created in the Exchange database.
Represents a response object for accepting meeting invitations.
Represents a response object for canceling a calendar item.
Represents a response object for declining meeting invitations.
Represents a response object for forwarding an item to other users.
Represents a response object for removing a canceled meeting from a calendar.
Represents a response object for replying to all recipients of an item.
Represents a response object for replying to the sender of an item.
Represents a response object for tentatively accepting a meeting invitation.
Represents a response object that is used to suppress read receipts.

remarks.para: Note: cannot be used to create distribution lists, meeting messages, meeting request messages, meeting response messages, and meeting cancellation messages.

example.para: The following code example shows a CreateItem request that creates a single e-mail, sends it to several recipients, and saves a copy of it in the Sent Items default folder.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType ^ Items { ExchangeWebServices::NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the collection of items to create.
Docs.value: The property returns a collection that contains all the items to create.

remarks.para: The collection can contain any of the following items:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::MessageDispositionType MessageDisposition { ExchangeWebServices::MessageDispositionType get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::MessageDispositionType value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an enumeration that describes how an item is handled after it is created. This property is required for e-mail messages.
Docs.value: The property returns a enumeration value that represents how an item is handled after it is created.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MessageDispositionSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::TargetFolderIdType ^ SavedItemFolderId { ExchangeWebServices::TargetFolderIdType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::TargetFolderIdType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the folder in which new items are saved.
Docs.value: The property returns a that identifies which folder contains saved items.

remarks.para: If this property is not set, the default folder for saving items is used. Saved e-mail messages will be saved in the default Drafts folder.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType SendMeetingInvitations { ExchangeWebServices::CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an enumeration that describes how meeting requests are handled after they are created. This property is required for calendar items.
Docs.value: The property returns a enumeration value that represents how meeting requests are handled.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SendMeetingInvitationsSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the is serialized into the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) request.
Docs.value: The property returns true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the property returns false.
